H0.text: Worms are the young that hatch from butterfly eggs.

H1.text: Cocoons are the young that butterfly eggs hatch into.

H2.text: Caterpillars are the young that hatch from butterfly eggs.

H3.text: Little butterflies are the young that hatch from butterfly eggs.

A4.text: their larvae, known as caterpillars, will feed

A5.text: The pupa or chrysalis, unlike that of moths, is not wrapped in a cocoon
